A recipe for challah

Since the beginning of my relationship with Anja Iâ€™ve been periodically baking challahs for shabbos. This page details the recipe I use, and how Iâ€™ve been refining it through the years.

April 2022

Iâ€™ve been experimenting with dough variation, choosing a more pastry-style dough instead of something thatâ€™s traditionally bready.

Baking bread, to me, can instantly turn into failure if what I taste three hours later isnâ€™t as fluffy and fresh as it was when it came out of the oven. Julia Turshenâ€™s recipe for jam buns turns out to be perfect for challah. I still use the braiding technique from Gefilteria, and substitute half of Juliaâ€™s butter for olive oil to add some extra fluff. Itâ€™s heaven.
